contentrichtext.text: In [[telecommunication]], a '''narrowband modem''' is a [[modem]] whose modulated [[output]] [[Signalling (telecommunication)|signal]] has an essential [[frequency]] spectrum that is limited to that which can be wholly contained within, and faithfully transmitted through, a voice [[channel (communications)|channel]] with a nominal 4 kHz [[Bandwidth (signal processing)|bandwidth]]. ''Note:'' [[High frequency]] (HF) modems are limited to operation over a voice channel with a nominal 3 kHz bandwidth. ==References== {{FS1037C MS188}} [[Category:Modems]] {{compu-network-stub}}
